title: Defeated & isolated, Pak turns to China for 'enhanced security ties'
content: Amidst the fallout from Operation Sindoor, Pakistan's Foreign Minister Ishaq Dar is set to visit China for bilateral talks, focusing on regional stability and security cooperation. Discussions will also involve Afghanistan, addressing trade and security concerns following the recent conflict with India.

title: Top LeT terrorist behind 3 major attacks on India killed in Pakistan's Sindh
content: Top Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist Razaullah Nizamani, also known as Abu Saiullah, responsible for attacks in India, has been killed by unidentified gunmen in Pakistan's Sindh province. Nizamani, who had government-provided security, was shot near a crossing after leaving his residence. This incident follows the neutralization of nearly 100 terrorists by Indian Armed Forces in Operation Sindoor.

title: IPL 2025: Sai, Gill show DC what they have been missing this season
content: KL Rahul scored a century for Delhi Capitals. Gujarat Titans openers Sai Sudharsan and Shubman Gill dominated. They achieved a record-breaking opening stand. Gujarat Titans won by 10 wickets. Sudharsan scored 108*, and Gill made 93*. Gujarat Titans secured a playoff spot. Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings also benefited. The match showcased strong batting performances.

title: US warms to Turkey: Military deal triggers silent ripples in South Asia
content: Under Trump's second term, the US has approved the sale of AIM-120C-8 AMRAAM missiles to Turkey, aiming to bolster NATO and US foreign policy. This decision arrives amidst Turkey's support for Pakistan, particularly regarding Kashmir, straining relations with India. Despite past tensions over Turkey's purchase of the Russian S-400 system, this sale highlights Turkey's continued reliance on US defense technology.

title: US Embassy in India issues warning of permanent ban on traveling: If you...
content: The U.S. Embassy in India has issued a warning about the consequences of overstaying visas. Indian citizens traveling to the U.S. on work, student, or tourist visas risk deportation and a permanent ban if they remain beyond their authorized stay.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after DC vs GT match
content: Gujarat Titans showcased their dominance by defeating Delhi Capitals by 10 wickets, securing their playoff berth in IPL 2025. Shubman Gill and Sai Sudharsan's unbeaten 205-run partnership led GT to effortlessly chase down DC's 200-run target. Royal Challengers Bengaluru and Punjab Kings also secured playoff spots, while Mumbai Indians, Delhi Capitals, and Lucknow Super Giants compete for the final slot.

title: Priety Zinta's appearance sets internet on fire as PBKS near IPL playoffs
content: Preity Zinta's vibrant presence in the stands fueled Punjab Kings as they clinched a crucial 10-run victory against Rajasthan Royals. Harpreet Brar's game-changing spell and explosive half-centuries from Nehal Wadhera and Shashank Singh powered PBKS to a formidable total. With this win, Punjab Kings are now within touching distance of securing their first playoff berth since 2014.

title: India, EU conclude 11th round of FTA talks, deal likely in two phases
content: India and the European Union have concluded the 11th round of FTA negotiations, agreeing to a two-stage approach to finalize the deal by 2025. Amid global trade uncertainties, both sides are focusing on market access for goods, services, and investment.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of its Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: Shubman Gill becomes second-fastest Indian to 5000 T20 runs
content: Shubman Gill achieved a milestone in the IPL 2025 match against Delhi Capitals. He became the second-fastest Indian to score 5000 T20 runs. KL Rahul earlier smashed an unbeaten century. Gill and Sai Sudharsan had a crucial partnership. Their performance took Gujarat closer to a playoff berth. Rahul also became the fastest Indian to 8000 T20 runs.

title: Microsoft's fired AI director to 6k laid off employees: 'These are people …'
content: Microsoft recently laid off approximately 6,000 employees, impacting various levels and teams. Gabriela de Queiroz, Director of AI for Startups, was among those affected, expressing sadness but maintaining a positive outlook. The layoffs coincide with Microsoft's aggressive push into AI, even as software engineers and AI leadership roles were impacted by the cuts.

title: Global layoff spree: Microsoft, Amazon among firms cutting jobs; thousands affected
content: Global corporations, including Microsoft, Amazon, Panasonic, PwC, CrowdStrike, and Burberry, are implementing significant job cuts affecting thousands. Driven by structural overhauls, cost-cutting, and a focus on profitability, these layoffs signal an industry-wide shift towards leaner operations.

title: 'Special' KL Rahul becomes first right-hander to hit a century in IPL 2025
content: KL Rahul's magnificent unbeaten century propelled Delhi Capitals to a formidable 199 for 3 against Gujarat Titans. Rahul's record-breaking 112*, the highest individual score against the Titans, showcased his exceptional timing and temperament. He also became the fastest Indian to reach 8000 T20 runs, solidifying his place among the T20 elite.

title: Forced to destroy! US rejects 15 mango shipments from India
content: US authorities have rejected fifteen mango shipments from India at various airports due to documentation irregularities concerning mandatory irradiation treatment. Exporters face approximately $500,000 in losses as they were compelled to dispose of the fruit locally due to high re-exportation costs.

title: 'Somtime win, sometime learn and ... ': Arshdeep's post goes viral
content: Punjab Kings defeated Rajasthan Royals in a tense match. Arshdeep Singh's Instagram post went viral. His post was a playful jab at Mohammad Rizwan. Harpreet Brar's spell turned the game. Nehal Wadhera and Shashank Singh boosted PBKS to 219. PBKS moved closer to playoff qualification. Arshdeep's post injected off-field flavour. Fans reacted with humour on social media.

title: Guns silent, but J&K border villagers still living in fear
content: Despite a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, villagers along the LoC and IB in Jammu live with the constant reminder of recent hostilities. Unexploded shells litter the landscape, hindering farming and daily life, while the once-thriving border tourism at Suchetgarh has ground to a halt.

title: Father defends alleged 'spy' YouTuber: 'Can't she call Pak friends?'
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a YouTuber, has been arrested by Haryana Police on suspicion of espionage. Her father claims she visited Pakistan solely for YouTube content creation with proper permissions. Police allege Malhotra was in contact with Pakistani intelligence, met an officer in Delhi, and shared sensitive information. Authorities seized phones and laptops, registering a case under the Official Secrets Act.

title: KL Rahul breaks Virat Kohli's big record, becomes fastest Indian to ...
content: KL Rahul etched his name in T20 history, becoming the fastest Indian to amass 8000 runs, eclipsing Virat Kohli's record. During a crucial IPL match against Gujarat Titans, Rahul's explosive innings saw him reach the milestone in just 224 innings, surpassing Kohli's 243. Only Chris Gayle and Babar Azam achieved this feat quicker.

title: SC to hear MP minister's plea on Monday over remarks against Col Qureshi
content: The Supreme Court is set to hear Madhya Pradesh minister Vijay Shah's plea challenging a high court order to file an FIR against him for remarks about Colonel Sofiya Qureshi during 'Operation Sindoor' briefings. The apex court previously admonished Shah for his statements, emphasising the need for restraint in public discourse, especially for those in constitutional positions.

title: Mustafizur Rahman's crazy 24 hours: T20I in Sharjah, IPL in Delhi
content: Mustafizur Rahman experienced a whirlwind 24 hours, playing for Bangladesh in a T20I against the UAE in Sharjah, where he took 2/17. He then traveled over 2,000 km to Delhi to join Delhi Capitals for their IPL match against Gujarat Titans, replacing Mitchell Starc. Gujarat Titans won the toss and chose to bowl, bringing Kagiso Rabada back into their lineup.

title: India’s pharma sector grows 7.8% in April; govt says, 'success of smart schemes'
content: India's pharmaceutical sector is experiencing rapid growth, with a 7.8% year-on-year increase in April 2025, driven by strong domestic demand and new product introductions. The country is a leading global supplier of generic medicines and vaccines, with government attributing its initiatives like the PMBJP and PLI schemes. Foreign investment is also robust, making India an attractive destination for pharmaceutical enterprises.

title: Brar's heroics help Punjab Kings beat Rajasthan Royals by 10 runs
content: Harpreet Brar's exceptional spell of 3 for 22 led Punjab Kings to a 10-run victory over Rajasthan Royals in a high-scoring match. PBKS, propelled by half-centuries from Nehal Wadhera and Shashank Singh, posted 219/5. Despite strong starts from Jaiswal and Suryavanshi, and a fifty from Jurel, RR fell short, with Brar's crucial wickets derailing their chase.

title: Emilia Romagna Grand Prix results: Max Verstappen clinches second win of season
content: Max Verstappen secured his second win of the season at the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix, with Lando Norris finishing second and Oscar Piastri third. Lewis Hamilton delivered his best performance for Ferrari, finishing fourth after a challenging qualifying race. Alex Albon impressed with late-race overtakes, while Kimi Antonelli's mechanical issue brought out the safety car.

title: Israel launches major ground offensive in Gaza
content: Israel has initiated a significant ground operation, "Gideon's Chariots," in Gaza, escalating the ongoing conflict. Simultaneously, prime minister Netanyahu's team is in Doha pursuing a deal involving hostage release, Hamas' departure, and Gaza's disarmament. Recent Israeli strikes have reportedly hit numerous targets, resulting in massive Palestinian casualties, including women and children.

title: India-UK FTA boost: Trade vol expected to double in 5-6 years, says ICRA
content: India's apparel and home textile trade with the UK is poised for substantial growth, potentially doubling in the next five to six years, fueled by the recently finalized Free Trade Agreement. The FTA, expected to take effect in 2026, will eliminate tariffs on most Indian textile exports, leveling the playing field with competitors and driving investment in production capacity.

title: Assam CM makes explosive claim on Gogoi's Pak visit, Cong MP calls him 'troll'
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has accused Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi of visiting Pakistan on ISI's invitation for training, alleging close ties with the Pakistani establishment. Sarma claims to possess solid evidence, promising its release by September 10. Gogoi refuted the allegations, questioning Sarma's potential resignation if the claims are unproven.

title: Criticised for being overweight, Sarfaraz sheds 10 kg ahead of England tour
content: Sarfaraz Khan, often criticized for his weight, is now prioritizing fitness. Despite Sunil Gavaskar's defense of his performance over physique, Sarfaraz has shed 10 kg in a month, spurred by his India A selection and IPL snub.

title: After India raises red flag, IMF issues warning & sets 11 new riders for Pak bailout
content: The IMF has imposed 11 new conditions on Pakistan's bailout program, raising the total to 50, and cautioned that escalating tensions with India could jeopardize fiscal and reform objectives. These conditions include parliamentary approval of the federal budget, agricultural income tax reforms, and liberalization of used car imports.

title: Nusraat Faria, who played Sheikh Hasina in Mujib biopic, arrested in Dhaka: Reports
content: Nusraat Faria, the actress who portrayed Sheikh Hasina in the biopic "Mujib: The Making of a Nation," has been arrested at Dhaka airport. The arrest is linked to an attempted murder case filed during anti-government protests in August 2024, which led to the fall of Sheikh Hasina's government. Faria was reportedly attempting to travel to Thailand when she was apprehended.

title: Bomb blast outside California fertility clinic: What we know so far
content: A powerful bomb exploded outside a fertility clinic in Palm Springs, California, resulting in one fatality and multiple injuries. The FBI has declared the incident an act of terrorism, launching a large-scale investigation. Authorities are working to determine the motive and whether the attack was domestic or international, while also investigating if the explosion was livestreamed.

title: Yashasvi's carnage leaves Arshdeep with IPL record he'd rather forget
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's explosive start, smashing 22 runs in the first over against Arshdeep Singh, set the tone for Rajasthan Royals' chase after Punjab Kings posted a formidable 219/5. Arshdeep's expensive over became a record he'd rather forget, overshadowing impressive batting performances from Nehal Wadhera and Shashank Singh for Punjab.

title: 'Tharoor looking for berth ...': CPI Kerala slams Cong MP
content: CPI Kerala Secretary Binoy Viswam criticized Shashi Tharoor for leading a delegation to brief partner countries on terrorism, suggesting Tharoor seeks a place within BJP's influence in Congress. Tharoor defended his acceptance, citing national interest and a request from Kiren Rijiju, while Congress nominated other representatives like Anand Sharma and Gaurav Gogoi for the delegation.

title: Scientists gave ants caffeine—what happened next would blow your mind
content: Argentine ants, notorious for their widespread colonies and displacement of native species, pose a significant challenge. Scientists discovered that small doses of caffeine can significantly improve their learning and memory, enabling them to locate food sources more efficiently. This enhanced recall leads to stronger chemical trails, attracting more ants to the bait, potentially improving pest control strategies.

title: Aishwarya Rai-Abhishek Bachchan dance as Rahul Vaidya sings Kajra Re: Top 5 news
content: Entertainment news is buzzing with updates! Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan's dance at a wedding went viral, while Anu Aggarwal claims she's still owed money for 'Aashiqui.' Jacqueline Fernandez's manager faced backlash for pushing a fan, and Paresh Rawal exited 'Hera Pheri 3.' Shraddha Kapoor's involvement in Ekta Kapoor's next film is uncertain amid payment dispute rumors.

title: Taarak Mehta's Munmun Dutta shares throwback pics with OG Nattu Kaka aka Ghanshyam Nayak
content: Munmun Dutta, celebrated as Babita Ji in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah,' recently shared nostalgic throwback pictures on Instagram, fondly remembering the late Ghanshyam Nayak, famously known as Nattu Kaka. The snapshots, dating back six years, capture lighthearted moments between them.

title: Curran breaks silence on 'crying like a child' claim amid Indo-Pak tensions
content: England's Tom Curran has refuted claims that he was seen crying at the airport due to India-Pakistan tensions, which disrupted cricket schedules. These rumours originated from Rishad Hossain's comments, but Curran addressed them humorously on Instagram, denying any emotional breakdown. Hossain has since apologised for his misrepresentation, and with tensions easing, the PSL is set to resume.

title: 17 killed in fire at a building in Hyderabad; PM Modi condoles deaths
content: A significant fire erupted early Sunday in Guzar House, near Hyderabad's Charminar, prompting a swift emergency response. Fire department officials, alerted around 6:30 am, found numerous unconscious individuals within the building. Approximately 20 people were rushed to nearby hospitals for treatment, according to an AIMIM legislator who visited the site.

title: 'He didn't look back': Shastri's bold call that transformed Rohit's Test career
content: Ravi Shastri revealed that a hunch during the 2019 World Cup led to Rohit Sharma's promotion to Test opener. Shastri believed Rohit's aggressive ODI approach could translate to Test success, convincing Virat Kohli to implement the change. Rohit seized the opportunity, scoring twin centuries in his first match as opener and transforming his Test career.

title: Rajasthan Royals' Fazalhaq Farooqi creates unwanted record in IPL 2025
content: Rajasthan Royals' pacer Fazalhaq Farooqi is facing a tough IPL 2025 season, having gone wicketless in 17 overs across four matches, conceding 210 runs. Despite his recent struggles, he was previously a top T20 wicket-taker and excelled in the 2024 T20 World Cup.

title: With a three-shot lead, Scottie Scheffler looks inevitable
content: After a torrid finish to his third round, Scheffler is in full control. Can anyone make it a contest on Sunday?

title: Phillies reliever Alvarado gets 80-game PED ban
content: Phillies reliever Jose Alvarado has been suspended 80 games without pay for violating Major League Baseball's drug policy.

title: Sources: Nuggets' Gordon has Grade 2 strain
content: Nuggets power forward Aaron Gordon faces long odds to play in Game 7 against the Thunder, as he has a Grade 2 hamstring strain and needs several weeks to recover from the injury, sources told ESPN.

title: Ohanian: Chelsea women can be America's team
content: Alexis Ohanian has said Chelsea can be "America's team" and backed the club to become "a billion dollar franchise one day."

title: McLaughlin destroys car, misses shot at Indy pole
content: Scott McLaughlin crashed his Team Penske car and ruined his chance to repeat last year's Indianapolis 500 pole-winning run.

title: Dodgers release veteran Taylor, activate Edman
content: The Dodgers have released utilityman Chris Taylor, a postseason hero who has been with the team since 2016, and activated Tommy Edman.

title: Alcaraz beats Sinner again to win Italian Open
content: Carlos Alcaraz defeated Jannik Sinner 7-6 (5), 6-1 to win his first Italian Open on Sunday and add another big clay-court title to his résumé.

title: Clark, new-look Fever rout Sky in chippy opener
content: The Fever started their season Saturday with a blowout victory over the Sky, a triple-double from Caitlin Clark, a career milestone for Fever newcomer DeWanna Bonner and a kerfuffle between Clark and the Sky's Angel Reese.

title: Sources: Celts' Brown has partial meniscus tear
content: Celtics star Jaylen Brown finished the season with a partially torn right meniscus and will be evaluated this coming week to determine if surgery is needed, sources told ESPN.

title: 'He turned his back on us': What it was like watching Juan Soto's Bronx return with the Bleacher Creatures
content: Betrayal. Crossed-out jerseys. And a boatload of expletives. Inside a wild Subway Series as a former Yankees hero returns a hated Met.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Who wins Game 7 of Panthers-Maple Leafs?
content: The winner heads to the conference finals; the loser an early vacation. Here are key players, score picks.

title: Morales puts division on notice with TKO of Burns
content: Michael Morales stamped himself as a real threat in the welterweight division with an impressive TKO.

title: Sources: Frimpong set for Liverpool medical
content: Right wing-back Jeremie Frimpong is set to undergo a medical at Liverpool this week as he closes in a move from Bayer Leverkusen, sources have told ESPN.

title: Ratcliffe misses Man Utd in FA Cup final again
content: Manchester United minority owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe was not present at Wembley to watch the women's side play in the FA Cup final on Sunday.

title: Everton win to give Goodison Park fitting farewell
content: Everton gave Goodison Park a fitting farewell after Iliman Ndiaye scored twice to give the home side a 2-0 victory over already-relegated Southampton.

title: Pep: 'Don't know' why Haaland didn't take pen
content: Pep Guardiola admitted he thought Erling Haaland would take Manchester City's penalty during their FA Cup final defeat to Crystal Palace and revealed it was "decided on the pitch" that Omar Marmoush would step up before his miss.

title: Henderson on avoiding red card: 'Who cares?'
content: Crystal Palace goalkeeper Dean Henderson said, "Who cares?" and insisted he knew he would save Omar Marmoush's penalty after an FA Cup final red card reprieve.

title: USMNT's Richards: FA Cup win means world to me
content: Alabama-native Chris Richards hailed his unlikely journey to becoming just the second American to play in and win an FA Cup final on Saturday.

title: Player hospitalized after falling while taking selfie
content: Deportivo La Coruña forward Zakaria Eddahchouri is "under observation" in hospital after falling from a seaside promenade while trying to take a selfie.

title: Fastest to 25: Chawinga sets NWSL scoring record
content: Temwa Chawinga's goal on Friday night secured a 1-0 win for the Kansas City Current against the Orlando Pride, making her the quickest player in NWSL history to reach 25 goals.

title: Brilliant Bompastor guides Chelsea to FA Cup glory vs. Man United
content: Chelsea beat Manchester United 3-0 at Wembley Stadium to complete a clean sweep of the women's domestic honors.

title: How Boston avoids breaking up its roster, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: How Alexis DeBoer has made a name for herself with Washington softball
content: While her famous dad went to Alabama to coach the Tide, Alexis DeBoer followed her dream to play for the Huskies.

title: Handing out grades for every full-time Cup driver: From four A's to a painful F
content: From an overachieving Kyle Larson to a struggling Brad Keselowski, we have report cards ahead of Sunday's All-Star Race.

title: From the Rolling Stones to Drake: Each time Barcelona has rocked an artist's logo on its kit
content: Since Barcelona and Spotify agreed to a sponsorship deal in March 2022, they have collaborated on a few firsts.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man City to spend £180m to land Wirtz and Reijnders
content: Manchester City will spend big to make sure they land Florian Wirtz and Tijjani Reijnders. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Who are the best coaches in college football? We rank the top 10
content: Kirby Smart has to be No. 1, or does he? What about Ryan Day? Or Marcus Freeman? Who made our list -- and why.

title: 49ers QB Brock Purdy is no longer Mr. Irrelevant: New contract comes with pressure to lead, win
content: San Francisco has long benefited from the league's best bargain contract. Now, it's on Purdy to deliver results.

title: Diplomatic outreach revives memories of ‘dream teams’ that got India out of tight corners
content: The regional and domestic situation quickly morphed into a diplomatic challenge for India when the West powers and human rights watchdogs turned rights into a major tool of diplomacy

title: Hyderabad and Amaravati will emerge as top two cities in future: Chandrababu Naidu
content: Telugu people are a symbol of economic creativity and will be at the forefront when India emerges as the world’s leading economy by 2047, says CM

title: Masula Beach Festival to be celebrated at Manginapudi Beach from June 6 to 8
content: The beach is being decked up for the festival, and cultural programmes, book stalls, beach kabaddi and other competitions will be arranged, says Excise Minister Kollu Ravindra

title: Over 42 unexploded shells from recent cross-border artillery firing destroyed in J&K’s Poonch
content: Indian Army safely neutralises 42 unexploded ordnances in border areas, ensuring civilian safety and normalcy in conflict zones

title: Uphill task ahead for government gearing up to implement free bus travel scheme for women
content: APSRTC may have to allocate 7,930 buses from its fleet for the free bus travel, induct 2,045 additional buses and recruit 11,479 additional staff, including 5,016 drivers, 5016 conductors and 1,447 maintenance staff

title: 70 applications received for scheme to produce electronic components
content: Sources have said earlier that Tata Electronics, Dixon Technologies, and Foxconn were among the big players that have shown interest.

title: Thoothukudi’s furniture park remains largely unoccupied three years after its launch
content: Raising concern over the slow development of the park, investors cite problems with electricity and water facilities and inadequate promotional activity from the State government as the reasons

title: Adani partners with Sparton to develop anti-submarine warfare solutions
content: The partnership aims to localise the production and assembly of complex electronic sensors, navigation systems, and ASW solutions in India under the ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’ and ‘Make in India’ initiatives, reducing India’s dependence on imports and foreign OEMs for critical naval technologies

title: West Bengal police issue summons to protesting teachers for damaging government property
content: The police resorted to baton charge to clear the teachers who were protesting the cancellation of appointments of about 26,000 teachers outside Bikash Bhawan on May 15

title: The tussle for temple turf
content: West Bengal’s newly built Jagannath Dham, constructed at a cost of ₹250 crore in the coastal town of Digha as a replica of the 12th-century Jagannath Temple in Puri, Odisha, has triggered a row between the two States, finds Shiv Sahay Singh. The temple has cultural and religious significance for those in India’s east, but is also being politically pushed as a counter to what is perceived as the BJP’s ‘north Indian’ Lord Ram

title: Hyderabad Gulzar Houz fire accident: CM Revanth Reddy orders probe into fire accident, commends fire personnel
content: The Chief Minister also commended the Fire Services authorities for their prompt response averting heavy loss of lives in the fire incident

title: Jaishankar to visit Netherlands, Denmark and Germany
content: S. Jaishankar will meet the leadership of the three countries and hold discussions with his counterparts on the entire gamut of bilateral relations, regional and global matters of mutual interest

title: Saroj Ghose, father of India’s science museum movement, passes away
content: The founding Director General of the National Council of Science Museums served in that capacity from 1979 to 1997

title: Two ‘radicalised youth’ arrested by Vizianagaram police
content: The accused, natives of Hyderabad and Vizianagaram, were making bombs and involved in anti-national activities, police officials said

title: Gulzar Houz fire accident: Pearl traders’ legacy burnt to ashes, 17 from three generations killed
content: On Saturday evening, the entire family had attended a function with Pankaj’s elder brother Govind, who now lives in Attapur. He had urged them to stay the night. But they returned home around 11 p.m.

title: Supreme Court directs States, Union Territories to reclaim reserved forests allotted to private parties
content: Court declares as illegal the allotment of 11.89 hectares of reserve forest land in Pune for agricultural purposes in 1998 and its sale to a builder the very next year

title: Catholic Congress reasserts relevance of Church leadership
content: Catholic Congress’ international conference takes place in Palakkad. Christians in Kerala will present a united front on key issues, says Thalassery Archbishop Mar Joseph Pamplany

title: Special Supervisory Officer appointed for Animal Welfare in Eluru district
content: The Special Supervisory Officer has been appointed as per the orders of the A.P. High Court and the guidelines of the Animal Welfare Board, to prevent the illegal transportation and slaughter of animals

title: Govt. clears Munnuru-Palair link canal with ₹162 crore to stabilise 2.54 lakh acres ayacut
content: Minister Uttam Reddy examines Bette Thand, Janpahad LI schemes in Suryapet district taken up with ₹304 crore

title: BRS flays govt. for its over-dependency on revenue from liquor sales
content: Party leader Harish Rao says Congress had promised to control liquor flow, but now it’s planning to allow 100 micro breweries

title: Gogoi dismisses Assam CM’s allegations as lies and slander
content: Gaurav Gogoi trashes Himanta Biswa Sarma’s accusation that he visited Pakistan at the invitation of the Inter-Services Intelligence

title: AIMPLB to resume its demonstrations against the Waqf Act
content: The Board had temporarily suspended its protests in solidarity with the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Listen to your conscience, Congress tells its leaders picked by government for all-party delegations
content: The Congress has accused the BJP-led government of playing ‘cheap political games’ by picking just one of the four names nominated by the party for the delegations, but including four other Congress leaders whom the party did not nominate

title: Six ministers review arrangements for TDP’s maiden Mahanadu in Kadapa
content: Party had won a majority of seats in the undivided Kadapa during the general elections last year, thus gaining strength in the district, which had been a bastion of the YSR family for four decades

title: Travel vlogger arrested for espionage was being groomed by Pakistani officials as an ‘asset’: Hisar Police
content: Jyoti Rani was in touch with more YouTube influencers and attended social gatherings of Pakistani intelligence officials, say police

title: Work hard to win KMC polls, Minister Bharath tells party leaders
content: Minister T. G. Bharath has asked party leaders and aspiring candidates to begin groundwork immediately and build strong connections with people

title: Kalaignar University will function temporarily on govt. college campus in Kumbakonam: Minister
content: Sources say arts and science colleges in Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, Ariyalur and Nagapattinam are expected to be brought under the jurisdiction of the Kalaignar University

title: Pinarayi blames Centre for slashing SC/ST education funds
content: Chief Minister says his government will initiate schemes to ensure that the SC/ST communities are not left behind in Kerala’s development journey

title: Pakistan to send diplomatic delegation abroad to counter India's global outreach
content: Former Foreign Minister and head of the Pakistan People’s Party (PPP), Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, will head the delegation

title: Left-wing groups reject charges of government interference in KTU
content: Controversy centres around a government inquiry into the alleged denial of PhD admission to a former Syndicate member of the university

title: Munambam petitions to be heard afresh under old Waqf Act
content: A new judicial officer is set to assume charge as chairperson of Waqf Tribunal this week. The Waqf Act 1995 will continue to govern the cases as the acts challenged before the tribunal took place much before the enactment of Waqf Amendment Act 2025

title: Steps in place to revive past glory of Agriculture Department, says Sarvepalli MLA
content: Somireddy points out that the TDP-led alliance government has restarted the scheme to distribute farm equipment on subsidy to farmers

title: Eight killed in garment factory fire accident in Maharashtra’s Solapur district
content: The deceased individuals include the factory owner, identified as Haji Usman Hasanbhai Mansuri, three members of his family including his one-and-a-half-year old grandson, and four workers.

title: Permanant solution promised to flooding of farmlands in Nidadavole
content: The assurance comes in the wake of the 2024 Godavari floods, which caused flooding of the Yerrakaluva river, resulting in the inundation of vast stretches of paddy fields in the Nidadavole assembly

title: Curbs on imports from Bangladesh impact Tripura
content: All-Tripura Merchant Association, however, says the restrictions will have a brief impact as the items imported from Bangladesh are also available in India

title: India to apprise FATF of the latest evidence on terror infrastructure in Pakistan
content: The gruesome killings in Pahalgam have necessitated the sharing of information about the existing terror infrastructure in Pakistan with the international watchdog, a government official said

title: Tenant farmers’ association asks A.P. government to ensure supply of high-quality seeds
content: Conduct inspections of agencies and private seed shops, and take strict action to prevent the circulation of spurious seeds, association leaders urge Agriculture Department

title: Seventeen MPs, including Ravi Kishan, Supriya Sule, to receive Sansad Ratna Awards
content: Two departmentally related standing committees — Finance and Agriculture —  have also been chosen for their exceptional performance based on their reports presented to Parliament.

title: Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Razaullah Nizamani killed by unidentified gunmen in Sindh
content: The Lashkar operative was involved in the Indian Institute of Science attack of 2005 in Bengaluru and the terror strike at a CRPF camp at Rampur in 2001

title: Market rally adds Rs 3.35 Lakh crore to 9 of 10 top valued firms
content: the TOI Business Desk is a vigilant and dedicated team of journalists committed to delivering the latest and most relevant business news from around the world to readers of the Times of India . the desk ensures that TOI readers are well-informed about the ever-changing and dynamic world of commerce .

title: Larger Pak network at play? 'Spy' YouTuber was in touch with other influencers, say cops
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'Constitution supreme': CJI Gavai's big message on 3 pillars of democracy

title: YouTuber 'spy' Jyoti Malhotra was in Pakistan before Pahalgam attack: Police
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: Soldier Dies Of Bullet Injury From Own Rifle In J&K's Samba DIstrict
content: An army personnel died of a bullet injury from his service rifle inside a post near the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district on Sunday, officials said.

title: 30,000 Secretly Grown Marijuana Plants Destroyed In Turkey: Report
content: Turkey's drug squad has destroyed 30,000 marijuana plants being secretly grown in a vast terraced garden by the Tigris River that is on the UN Cultural Heritage list, media reports said on Sunday.

title: Lashkar Terrorist Abu Saifullah, Masterminded Of Key Attacks In India, Killed
content: A key terrorist of Lashkar E Taiba -- -- Rajullah Nizamani alias Abu Saifullah - has been shot dead in Pakistan's Sindh. Saifullah -- said to be involved in the attack on the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh headquarters in Nagpur in 2006 -- was shot dead

title: Video: No AC Inside Air India Plane In Delhi, Passenger Shares Ordeal
content: Passengers of an Air India flight at Delhi airport have complained they were made to sit inside the aircraft without air-conditioning on Sunday. The flight was scheduled to travel to Patna.

title: "May Hurt Bengal But...": Official On Impact Of Bangladesh Import Curbs
content: Though the Centre's move to restrict imports of certain goods from Bangladesh via land ports will have an impact on employment and transport revenue in West Bengal, the national interest is more important than the potential economic fallout.

title: 'Wife Died By Suicide, Stuffed Her In Bag Fearing Action': UP Man To Cops
content: Police found a woman's body stuffed inside a large suitcase at her residence here on Sunday after her family claimed that she had committed suicide, officials said.

title: Prashant Kishor Stopped From Entering Nitish Kumar's Ancestral Village
content: Jan Suraaj Party founder Prashant Kishor was on Sunday stopped by the administration from entering Kalyan Bigha, the ancestral village of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, where he wanted to interact with locals during his visit to Nalanda district.

title: Video: Farmer's Desperate Bid To Save Crop Amid Rain, Then A Call By Union Minister
content: A farmer in Maharashtra was seen desperately trying to save his produce from being washed away in a heavy downpour in a heartbreaking video doing the rounds on social media.

title: Mayawati Appoints Nephew Akash Anand BSP's Chief National Coordinator
content: In a significant move, the Bahujan Samaj Party's (BSP) national president Mayawati appointed her nephew Akash Anand as the party's Chief National Coordinator on Sunday.

title: After Himanta Sarma's "ISI Invite" Charge, Gaurav Gogoi's "Worse Than B-Grade Film" Retort
content: The war of words between Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma and Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi escalated today after Mr Sarma said the government has evidence of the Congress leader's visit to Pakistan on an invitation from the ISI.

title: 8 Killed After Short Circuit Triggers Massive Fire At Maharashtra Factory
content: Eight persons, including three women and a child, were killed in a massive fire at a factory in Maharashtra's Solapur district on Sunday, officials said.

title: Abu Saifullah, Lashkar Terrorist Behind 3 Attacks In India, Killed In Pak
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist Razaullah Nizamani alias Abu Saiullah, who was the brain behind the 2006 attack on the RSS headquarters, was killed by unidentified gunmen in Sindh province of Pakistan, officials here said.

title: "Warned Against Misuse": Sharad Pawar On Change In Anti-Money Laundering Law
content: Veteran politician Sharad Pawar said today that he had warned former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and his UPA government about the amendments in the PMLA, and the possibilities of their abuse under a different government.

title: Bangladeshi Actor, Nusraat Faria, Who Played Sheikh Hasina On Screen Arrested In Murder Case
content: Bangladeshi actress Nusraat Faria, who played the role of Bangladesh's former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in the biopic on her father, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, was arrested at Dhaka's Shahjalal International Airport.

title: "Mischievous": Congress On Centre's Snub To Its Diplomatic Outreach Nominees
content: The Congress has accused the BJP of politicising Operation Sindoor after only one of four names it suggested for all-party delegations to the international community was accepted.

title: Indian PhD Graduate Facing Deportation Wins Legal Battle To Stay In US
content: Priya Saxena, an Indian PhD student at a university in South Dakota, whom the Trump administration has been attempting to deport from the United States, has won a legal reprieve from a federal court, allowing her to stay in America.

title: How Hyderabad Building Turned Into Gas Chamber As Fire Raged
content: The death of 17 members of a family, including eight children, in a massive fire has left people shocked in Hyderabad.

title: Operation Ghost SIM: How Army, Assam Cops Tracked Down Pak-Linked Racket
content: Seven people have been arrested from across India for running a fake SIM card racket with links to Pakistani agents, the Assam Police said. At least 14 more people were detained from Assam's Dhubri district for questioning, the police said.

title: He Killed Man Who Harassed His Sister, Arrested 6 Months Later In Delhi
content: The Crime Branch of Delhi Police has arrested a man wanted in connection with a murder case that occurred in Narela six months ago.

title: India Emerges As Bright Spot In UN Report Amid Global Economic Slowdown
content: At a time when the global economy is facing what the United Nations calls a "precarious moment", India has emerged as a rare bright spot.

title: Early look at the Stars-Oilers matchup in the Western Conference finals
